definition: to look at one another/to face each other
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Bohai regime of Tang Dynasty had a frequent intercourse with Japan.
sentences.chinese: 唐代渤海政权与日本隔海相望，往来频繁。

sentences.english: But we, are two parallel lines, can only look, but can not intersect.
sentences.chinese: 而我们，注定是两条平行线，只能相望，却不能相交。

sentences.english: The imperial tombs lie opposite the palaces across Henghe River.
sentences.chinese: 王室墓群隔洹河与皇宫相望。

sentences.english: Shekou industrial zone is located in shenzhen, and Hong Kong island.
sentences.chinese: 蛇口工业区位于深圳，与香港隔海相望。

sentences.english: The two lovers were looking at each other with amorous eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一对情人脉脉含情地相望着。

sentences.english: Tortoise and Snake Hills face each other across the river.
New Zealand is an island that lies off the east of Australia.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰是澳大利亚以东隔海相望的一个岛屿。

sentences.english: A city of southern Sweden on the Oresund opposite Copenhagen.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典南部的一座城市，隔欧伦逊海峡与哥本哈根相望。

sentences.english: At this time the sea are not heard, China is willing to monthly Zhao Jun flow.
sentences.chinese: 此时相望不相闻，愿逐月华流照君。

sentences.english: Hainan province is offshore across from the Leizhou Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 其雷州半岛与海南省隔海相望。

sentences.english: Every week we’re getting closer to that ideal but we’re still a long way off.
sentences.chinese: 每周我们都盼望更接近理想，但总是遥遥相望。

sentences.english: China and ASEAN countries are linked by the same mountains and rivers or face each other across the sea.
sentences.chinese: 中国与东盟国家或山水相连，或隔海相望。

sentences.english: Faced with Rassia in the north across the sea.
sentences.chinese: 北部隔海与俄罗斯相望。

sentences.english: It lies in the North Atlantic Ocean off the north coast of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 它位于大西洋北部，与欧洲海洋的北海岸隔海相望。

sentences.english: Short sea, you see the face of tears, your heart broken injury.
sentences.chinese: 短暂的相望，见到你落泪的娇容，心为你伤碎。

sentences.english: And how could an island wipe out a metropolis an ocean away?
sentences.chinese: 一个小岛如何横扫隔海相望的大都市？

definition: to merge with/interlinking/to join with/to interlock
(separated only by) a narrow strip of water
distance apart/separated by a given distance
to be located at/to be situated in
